meanings.sent1: After waking up, she decided to redream the happy ending.
meanings.sent2: Every night, she would redream the magical world she had created in her mind.
meanings.sent3: He redreamed winning the lottery, but this time he shared the prize with his friends.
meanings.sent4: She redreamed her future as a successful artist, painting the world with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: In her mind, she could redream any scenario to make it better than reality.

meanings.definition: To imagine or envision something anew.
meanings.sent1: The architect decided to redream the entire layout of the building.
meanings.sent2: She would often redream her childhood memories with a touch of fantasy.

meanings.sent4: The author would redream the plot of her novel to add unexpected twists.
meanings.sent5: With a creative mind, he could redream any story to make it more exciting.
